subsection.name: 1. Overview
subsection.p: FnSet is a parameterizable function hub class and, before giving you access to the real functions, you will have to specify the type parameter, which will give you access to the functions containing the operations on Sets:

ul.li: FnSet.of(final Type<T> type): returns #FnSetOf<T> parameterized with the given type. This is the most generic function in FnSet
FnSet.ofArrayOf(final Type<T> type): returns FnSetOfArrayOf<T> parameterized with the given type.
FnSet.ofListOf(final Type<T> type): returns FnSetOfListOf<T> parameterized with the given type.
FnSet.ofSetOf(final Type<T> type): returns FnSetOfSetOf<T> parameterized with the given type.

subsection.name: FnSetOf
subsection.p: The functions in FnSetOf are applied on Sets. FnSetOf is a parameterizable class so, in order to use it, you must specify the type parameter (i.e. FnSet.ofBigDecimal(), FnSet.ofLong(), FnSet.of(final Type<T> type), ...). FnSet.of(final Type<T> type) is the most generic method that gives you access to FnSetOf though there are some shortcuts for common classes: FnSet.ofBigDecimal(), FnSet.ofInteger(), FnSet.ofDate(), FnSet.ofCharacter(), ... The examples below show how this functions can be used:

subsection.name: FnSetOfArrayOf
subsection.p: The functions in FnSetOfArrayOf are applied on Sets of Arrays of any type. FnSetOfArrayOf is a parameterizable class so, in order to use it, you must specify the type parameter (i.e. FnSet.ofArrayOf(Types.INTEGER), FnSet.ofArrayOf(Types.LONG)). The example below shows how it can be used:

subsection.name: FnSetOfListOf
subsection.p: The functions in FnSetOfListOf are applied on Sets of Lists of any type. FnSetOfListOf is a parameterizable class so, in order to use it, you must specify the type parameter (i.e. FnSet.ofListOf(Types.INTEGER), FnSet.ofListOf(Types.LONG)). The example below shows how it can be used:

subsection.name: FnSetOfSetOf
subsection.p: The functions in FnSetOfSetOf are applied on Sets of Sets of any type. FnSetOfSetOf is a parameterizable class so, in order to use it, you must specify the type parameter (i.e. FnSet.ofSetOf(Types.INTEGER), FnSet.ofSetOf(Types.LONG)). The example below shows how it can be used:
